reviews.review_msg: She is a wonderful prof.  My only complaint is that so much of your grade depends on group components and that's not fair to people who want really high grades.  I would rather have been assessed on my own work.  My own work was at a A-A+ range and my group's work was at a B+-A- range, so not really fair.  A lot of reading!!!  A lot of assignments.
Agree with the previous comments.  The course is a lot of hard work and so much reading but you also learn a lot.
Great prof.  A lot of work!!!  Attendance is mandatory due to the set-up of the course.  A lot of group components and presentations.
Very good teaching style. I was wary at first about the group work, but it proved to be very helpful in the laerning process. Take this professor!
John is a very helpful professor. Sure it helps to love CUPE, to do the countless readings, and to participate. Overall-a fair marker, but watch out: he gets technical like an english teacher!

John is a great teacher... he knows and loves what he teaches.... he is helpful and is always willing to help... take a class with him but be ready and willing to learn cause there are a lot of readings

Highly engaging class. Having guest speakers every week is a nice touch.The readings for the seminar are a)thoughtful b)accessible. If you have the option, I highly recommend taking courses taught by John.

Professors don't come any worse than John Calvert.  Rediculously boring lectures, rediculously boring readings.  If I didn't need the credits towards graduation, I would have dropped this course.  If you can, avoid him.  If you can't, then God help you.
Excellent. If you want to learn, Logan is the guy.

Logan is an amazing prof. He's so chilled and funny. Makes the class laugh every time. He knows his stuff and does a good job communicating it to the class. I have taken 4 classes with him. Exams and marking are fair. I highly recommend

Literally the best professor I've ever had, I've taken 3 classes with him so far and I can't stress enough how great of a teacher he is! He really tries to make sure you understand what it is that he's teaching and he is very empathetic. Highly recommend him to anyone interested in poli sci!
